result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Richard L Hover Jr was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
